query: My dashboard should show a summary view first, but let users expand to see all charts.
expected_behavior: Widget starts inline (default). Uses useDisplayMode to read displayMode and render compact/full view. Provides expand button calling setDisplayMode('fullscreen'). Provides collapse button to return to inline.

query: My document editor feels cramped. How can I let users expand it to full screen?
expected_behavior: Widget starts inline. Uses useDisplayMode. Provides button calling setDisplayMode('fullscreen'). Conditional rendering based on displayMode for compact vs full editor.

query: I want to show image details when clicking a thumbnail in my gallery. Should block the chat until user closes it.
expected_behavior: Uses useRequestModal. Calls open({ params: { image } }) on thumbnail click. Checks isOpen at widget root, returns modal content with params.image. Early return pattern.

query: Building a language learning flashcard game. Needs to stay visible while user asks for hints in chat.
expected_behavior: Widget starts inline. Provides button calling setDisplayMode('pip') to switch. Uses useDisplayMode. Pip mode persists and stays fixed on scroll.

query: Just need to show order confirmation with a tracking number. Nothing fancy.
expected_behavior: Inline mode (default) is sufficient. No switch controls needed. Simple widget renders before model response.
